action.action-desc: Mr. Cicilline (for himself, Mr. Brendan F. Boyle of Pennsylvania, Mr. Evans, Mr. Kilmer, Mr. Nolan, and Ms. Wilson of Florida) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase the deduction allowed for student loan interest and the limitation based on income, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Student Loan Interest Tax Deduction Expansion Act.

section.header: Increase in dollar limitation and income limitation on student loan interest deduction

subsection.header: Increase in dollar limitation on student loan interest deduction
subsection.text: Paragraph (1) of section 221(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking $2,500 and inserting $7,500 ($15,000 in the case of a joint return).

subsection.header: Increase in income limitation on student loan interest deduction
subsection.text: Paragraph (2) of section 221(b) of such Code is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.header: Limitation based on modified adjusted gross income

subparagraph.text: No deduction shall be allowed under subsection (a) to a taxpayer with a modified adjusted gross income over $100,000 ($200,000 in the case of a joint return).
The term modified adjusted gross income means adjusted gross income determined—

clause.text: without regard to this section and sections 199, 222, 911, 931, and 933, and

subsection.text: Paragraph (1) of section 221(f) of such Code is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: In the case of a taxable year beginning after 2018, the $100,000 and $200,000 amounts in subsection (b)(2) shall each be increased by an amount equal to—

subparagraph.text: the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting calendar year 2017 for calendar year 1992 in subparagraph (B) thereof.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years ending after December 31, 2017.
